result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lisa A Karshna

records.addlTxt:
3:15 PM Defendant Lisa A Karshna in court.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Lisa A Karshna.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Hughes has some paperwork his client needs to obtain to be shown to the assigned ADA and requests more time.
Hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:07 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. 
Defendant Lisa A Karshna in court.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Lisa A Karshna. 
Atty Hughes requests more time to conduct further investigation in this matter. 
State does not object.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:43 AM Defendant Lisa A Karshna in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on June 24, 2022
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Steven Hughes has been appointed to represent the defendant.
Preliminary hearing on July 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with any Target Store in Waukesha County.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

01:08 PM Defendant Lisa A Karshna in court, in custody, with attorney Steven Hughes.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.
